meanings.definition: To sell goods by going from place to place
meanings.sent1: The friendly neighbor peddles fresh vegetables from his garden.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor peddles handmade jewelry to tourists.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel peddles acorns to the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The wind peddles the colorful leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic child peddles lemonade on a hot summer day.

meanings.definition: To promote or spread (ideas, beliefs, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The politician peddles his vision for a better future to the voters.
meanings.sent2: The company peddles its new product through social media campaigns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf peddles rumors around the magical kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The melody peddles joy to all who listen.
meanings.sent5: The teacher peddles knowledge to eager young minds.

meanings.definition: To move or travel in a small, light vehicle
meanings.sent1: The children peddles their bicycles around the park.
meanings.sent2: The delivery person peddles packages on a sleek scooter.
meanings.sent3: The penguin peddles on an ice floe, looking for fish.
meanings.sent4: The butterfly peddles gracefully through the garden.
meanings.sent5: The explorer peddles a canoe down the peaceful river.
